User Experience and Research Program Manager, Cloud Support

at Google in Atlanta, GA from 2/21/2021

Google’s projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it’s your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project’s progress and deadlines. Google Cloud is changing the way the world uses cloud computing. Your passion, technical and business depth, and excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills will inspire our teams and rapidly establish trust amongst a diverse set of stakeholders and customers. You love data and harness its potential to influence stakeholders to adopt the processes and controls you create.

You will be an individual contributor who will bring industry knowledge, best practices in customer experience, and being able to incorporate that into an operational environment to deliver a seamless support experience. You will work with cross-functional teams and influence across all levels to solve big business problems.

Responsibilities

Lead the end to end management of strategic Support programs focused on improving the Customer Experience. Partner with initiative leads to execute large cross-functional programs with high visibility.
Drive and manage all aspects of the Support UXR program and other programs including resourcing, ROI analysis, communications, action planning and execution.
Work closely with Leadership, stakeholders and functional owners to convert customer research findings into actionable insights for solutioning and execution.
Create flexible and frictionless processes to keep all stakeholders connected, engaged and action oriented.
In partnership with UXR, conduct qualitative-based analyses to identify outcome-based OKRs and implement qualitative research methods (interviews) to obtain additional insight.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of CX or UX experience working cross-functionally (e.g., blending data with customer insights and journeys).
Experience using success metrics to drive insights across the user journey, propose initiatives and deliver actionable results.
Experiencing leading without authority and working in a matrixed environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of UX domain and keenness to solve for meaningful cross functional impact.
Ability to navigate complex business organizations, manage multiple cross-functional stakeholders and negotiate optimal solutions across all parties.
Ability to adapt messages to both technical and business audiences and influence without authority with excellent leadership and communication skills.
Strong background in process development, optimization and change management - creating order and systems out of ambiguity.
